completedHtml:
Thank you for submitting your application. A confirmation has been sent to your email.

If you need to update any information, you may refresh the page and resubmit your answers. Please note that any resubmitted answers will override all previous answers.

elements.name: first_name
elements.title: First Name

elements.name: last_name
elements.title: Last Name (Family Name)

elements.name: email
elements.title: Email

elements.name: phone
elements.title: Cell Phone

elements.name: student_number
elements.title: U of T Student Number

elements.name: utorid
elements.title: UTORid

elements.name: program
elements.title: At the start of the next academic term, your status at the University of Toronto will be...

elements.name: program_start
elements.title: When did you start your current program? (If you switched from a Masters to PhD program, please indicate official start of your PhD program.)
elements.requiredErrorText: Incorrect date format. Please specify the date as YYYY-MM-DD.

elements.name: department
elements.title: What is your program of study?

elements.name: gpa
elements.title: What is your cumulative GPA? (On a 4 point scale)

elements.name: transcripts
elements.title: Please upload your unofficial transcript(s), in PDF format.

elements.name: registered_during_session
elements.title: Will you be a registered student at the University of Toronto during the session for which you are applying?

elements.name: graduating_during_session
elements.title: Will you be graduating during the session for which you are applying?

elements.name: working_during_session
elements.title: Will you be on a work term or on a full-time internship during the session for which you are applying?

elements.name: completed_degrees
elements.title: Completed Degrees (if any; do not list degrees in progress)

elements.name: cv
elements.title: Please upload your CV/resume here, in PDF format.

elements.name: previous_experience_summary
elements.title: Please briefly summarize your teaching experience, if any.
elements.description: Prioritize teaching experience at U of T, but also include teaching experience at other universities, if applicable.

elements.name: previous_cs_ta
elements.title: Please briefly summarize your work experience relevant to TAships within CS, if any.

elements.name: research_interests
elements.title: Please briefly list your research interests and specialization(s), if any.

elements.name: previous_university_ta
elements.title: Have you held a TA position at the University of Toronto before this upcoming term?

elements.name: other_applications
elements.title: List any other campuses/departments/units where you have submitted or intend to submit a TA application for the session that you are applying for.

elements.name: ideal_workload
elements.title: What is your ideal workload of the TAship in the Department of Computer Science for this upcoming term?
elements.description:
The standard TA assignment is 60 hours in the Department of Computer Science.

The 30-hour positions are limited in number and typically reserved for CS graduate students researching in the course's field.

Note: TAships beyond 60 hours are rare in summer sessions and emergency postings.

We cannot guarantee assignments to students outside of the CS funded cohort of graduate students. For CS funded graduate students, we cannot guarantee hours beyond the standard 60 hours.
